item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Donovan McNabb says sharing snaps with Michael Vick is no problem
item.description: Donovan McNabb says he has no problem with Michael Vick taking some of his snaps and warns opponents that the two quarterbacks could be on the field together at times.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Patrick Kane, of Chicago Blackhawks, 'sincerely' sorry for arrest
item.description: Patrick Kane said he was "sincerely" sorry for his actions that led to his recent arrest following an altercation with a cab driver in Buffalo, N.Y.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Washington Nationals, No. 1 pick Strasburg face midnight deadline
item.description: The Washington Nationals face a midnight deadline to sign No. 1 overall draft pick Stephen Strasburg.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Shaun Ellis, of New York Jets, suspended without pay for opener
item.description: New York Jets defensive end Shaun Ellis has been suspended without pay for the team's regular-season opener and fined $100,000 by the NFL for violating the league's substance abuse policy.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Kansas City Chiefs sign receiver Ashley Lelie
item.description: The Kansas City Chiefs have signed free agent wide receiver Ashley Lelie.

item.dc:creator: David Newton
item.title: Lisa Mayfield, Jeremy Mayfield's stepmother, arrested at his home
item.description: Lisa Mayfield, the stepmother of Jeremy Mayfield and a witness for NASCAR in defending its suspension of the Sprint Cup driver, was arrested on Saturday night after an incident at her stepson's Catawba County house.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Usain Bolt's 9.58 at world championships shatters 100-meter record
item.description: Usain Bolt has captured another world record, winning the 100-meter race in 9.58 seconds at the world championships.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Andy Murray passes Rafael Nadal for No. 2 in ATP rankings
item.description: Andy Murray has overtaken Rafael Nadal in the ATP rankings, becoming the first British man to reach No. 2.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Michael Irvin and Chuck Liddell join 'Dancing With the Stars' contestants
item.description: Michael Irvin and Chuck Liddell will be among 16 celebrities from the worlds of entertainment and sports who will tango and foxtrot on the new season of "Dancing With the Stars."

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: PGA Championship: Y.E. Yang wins PGA Championship
item.description: Y.E. Yang won his first major title at the PGA Championship on Sunday, and he took down Tiger Woods to do it.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Brian Vickers outlasts Jimmie Johnson in fuel duel at Michigan International Speedway
item.description: Brian Vickers outlasted Jimmie Johnson in yet another fuel-mileage duel at Michigan International Speedway, taking the lead with two laps to go after Johnson ran out of gas and holding on to win his first Sprint Cup race of the season Sunday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Dallas Cowboys WR Roy Williams misses practice, is day to day
item.description: Dallas Cowboys receiver Roy Williams has missed practice because of a sore left wrist and his status is uncertain.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: New York Yankees' Derek Jeter becomes all-time hit leader amongst shortstops
item.description: Yankees captain Derek Jeter has passed Hall of Famer Luis Aparicio for most hits by a shortstop.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Mark Sanchez to start at QB for Jets in next game
item.description: Rookie quarterback Mark Sanchez, coming off an impressive NFL debut, will start the New York Jets' preseason game at Baltimore next week.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: New York Mets third baseman David Wright out of hospital with post-concussion symptoms after beaning
item.description: Mets third baseman David Wright was discharged Sunday from a hospital in New York a day after suffering a concussion when he was struck in the head by a pitch from San Francisco Giants starter Matt Cain.
